metadata.titleEn: Geochemical characteristics of sulfide minerals in the skarn Cu (AU) deposit, Fenghuangshan ore field, Tongling
metadata.description:
The data are in the form of jpg images, including: (1) binary curves of (a) Fe and s, (b) Cu and Fe in pyrite samples from baoshantao and Fenghuangshan skarn Cu (AU) deposits
(2) Trace element contents of pyrite samples from baoshantao and Fenghuangshan skarn Cu (AU) deposits (3) trace element contents of chalcopyrite from Fenghuangshan skarn Cu (AU) deposits (4) trace element contents of pyrite and brass samples from different stages of baoshantao and Fenghuangshan skarn Cu (AU) deposits (a) Au, (b) AG (c) The relationship between the contents of Pb and (d) sb and as (5) the contents of (a) Pb and Bi, (b) Pb / CO and Ag / Co, (c) Au and Cu in pyrite and chalcopyrite samples from baoshantao and Fenghuangshan skarn copper (gold) deposits (d) (6) LA-ICP-MS trace element correlation of Se Sn and CO as in chalcopyrite from Fenghuangshan deposit. (7) LA-ICP-MS trace element correlation of (a) Co and Ni, (b) se and as, (c) Au and Ni in pyrite and chalcopyrite from baoshantao and Fenghuangshan deposits
This data chart provides intuitive results for the study of sulfide mineral characteristics of skarn copper (gold) deposit in Fenghuangshan ore field, Tongling.
The article has been published in SCI journals, and the data is true and reliable.
metadata.instructions:
The date is stored in Excel format. The sample name is "YY DD", where YY represents the sampling location and DD represents the sample ordinal number.
Note: sb: Baoshan; FHS: Fenghuang mountain;

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of the geochemical features of sulfide minerals in skarn-type copper (gold) deposits, as represented in a dataset?
Feature Specification.Answer: binary curves of Fe and S, binary curves of Cu and Fe in pyrite samples, trace element contents in pyrite samples, trace element contents in chalcopyrite, relationships of Au, Ag, Pb, and Sb contents with As in different stages of pyrite and chalcopyrite samples, curves of Pb and Bi, Pb/Co and Ag/Co, Au and Cu, Sb and Tl in pyrite and chalcopyrite samples, Se-Sn and Co-As associations in chalcopyrite LA-ICP-MS trace elements, curves of Co and Ni, Se and As, Au and Ni in pyrite and chalcopyrite samples

Quantification.Question: How many binary curves are generated for the Fe and S elements from the pyrite samples in the skarn copper (gold) deposits of the Tongling Fenghuangshan ore field?

Comparison.Question: How do the microelement content analysis methods for pyrite and chalcopyrite samples in skarn copper-gold deposits compare to other mineralogical analysis techniques in terms of data reliability and visualization?
Comparison.Answer: The analysis methods for pyrite and chalcopyrite samples, as described, involve creating visual representations such as binary curves and correlation charts of various elements (e.g., Fe, S, Cu, Au, Ag) and microelements using techniques like LA-ICP-MS. These methods provide intuitive and reliable visual results for understanding sulfide mineral characteristics in skarn copper-gold deposits. The approach ensures data reliability through published results in a SCI journal, indicating peer-reviewed validation, which may offer an advantage in terms of clarity and accuracy over some other mineralogical analysis techniques that may not provide as direct or visually representative data.

Goal Orientation.Question: What are the primary objectives of compiling an atlas of geochemical characteristics of sulfide minerals from skarn copper (gold) deposits in the Tongling Fenghuangshan mining area, and how might these objectives influence data collection methods or dataset refinement?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objectives of compiling an atlas of geochemical characteristics of sulfide minerals from skarn copper (gold) deposits in the Tongling Fenghuangshan mining area are to provide a visual representation and detailed analysis of the mineralogical and geochemical features of these deposits. This includes presenting binary curves and trace element contents in pyrite and chalcopyrite samples from different stages of the deposits. Such objectives likely influence data collection methods by necessitating precise and comprehensive sampling of mineral specimens and employing advanced analytical techniques like LA-ICP-MS to ensure accuracy and reliability. The intention to publish in a scientific journal further implies a rigorous approach to data accuracy and presentation, aiming to contribute valuable insights to the domain.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What is the detailed procedure for collecting and analyzing microelement content in pyrite and chalcopyrite samples from skarn copper (gold) deposits?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The data collection involves analyzing microelement content in pyrite and chalcopyrite samples from the Tongling Fenghuangshan mining area. This includes generating binary curves of Fe and S, Cu and Fe, and assessing the microelement content in pyrite samples. Additionally, it involves analyzing the relationship between elements such as Au, Ag, Pb, Sb, and As in different stages of pyrite and chalcopyrite samples, as well as generating curves for Pb and Bi, Pb/Co and Ag/Co, Au and Cu, Sb and Tl, and analyzing LA-ICP-MS microelement association for Se-Sn and Co-As in chalcopyrite.
